Description: Furniture-fitting; part of a knob (?) or end of a stick or rod. Made of ivory and discoloured to grey, probably by burning; circular with flared edge, front (or top) slightly convex, with a square recess in the back for attachment.
Curator's comments: Very probably the "top of an ivory papyrus-flower" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 75 § 72) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.81, p.186, pl.28)
